heaviest_rainfall.status: Record-breaking rain fell on 04 January 2025 with a total accumulation of 36.8mm over 37.2 hours and falling at a rate of 4.6mm per hour at times.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain rate registered stands at 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, highlighting an extreme precipitation event.  21.19mm fell during the storm over 15.0 hours.

longest_rain.status: The record duration for continuous rain was set on 04 January 2025, the storm lasted 37.2 hours with a total precipitation of 36.8mm and it reached 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning activity recorded in a single day is 23, which occurred on 07 September 2025 (since our records began on 11 April 2025).

nearest_lightning.status: The nearest lightning strike ever noted was on 13 May 2025, at 4.97 miles distance.

storm.status: No storm activity at the moment.  The previous storm occurred on 10 September 2025 and lasted 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is no cold snap at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 cold snaps, with an average of 3.7 per year.

extreme.status: The maximum temperature difference seen is 26.7°C, observed on 29 April 2025 when the temperature fell to 0.4°C but also managed to reach 27.1°C on the same day.

heatwaves.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no heatwaves in progress.  So far, 6 heatwavess have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 1.9.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was 18 July 2025, there have been only 62 tropical nights since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (202°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The largest wind gust ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

run.status: The top recorded wind run is 1754 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The record wind speed remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 4.7°C) and outside temperature (down 3.4°C) and drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.5 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 201 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 1339 m), feels like temperature (up 6.8°C), outside temperature (up 4.9°C), and dew point temperature (up 1.6°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 200.8m lower than yesterday, 1049.3m lower than the past week, 1338.9m lower than the past month.

Yesterday’s cloud levels showed a low of 840m and a peak of 1760m, averaging 952.3m; the week and month recorded warmer averages.
cloud levels.summary: Partial cloudiness with some periods of sun.

summary.summary: Inside; anticipate mild and comfortable temperatures. Outside; pleasant, mild temperatures. Also, pleasant humidity levels and winds will be practically absent. A few light raindrops may fall, partial cloudiness with some periods of sun, and it’s dark. Changeable conditions.
